files.description: Project build and tool configuration (Python 3.11+, packaging metadata, pytest settings) to support reproducible local and CI/CD runs.
Package entrypoint exporting the blessed pipeline API as the single supported implementation path.
Blessed end-to-end pipeline implementation with corrected syntax and a stable public interface used by tests and CLI.
Command-line interface to run the blessed pipeline and optionally emit artifacts needed for integration validation.
Pytest suite that exercises the blessed pipeline API and guards against regressions that previously surfaced as syntax_error validation failures.
Support script that runs the test suite and writes a full transcript to outputs/test_run.log for the missionâ€™s required artifact.
Tracked test-run transcript artifact generated/overwritten by scripts/run_tests.py and CI to satisfy the requirement to store outputs/test_run.log.
CI/CD workflow that installs the project, runs scripts/run_tests.py, and uploads outputs/test_run.log as a build artifact.

missionDescription: Resolve integration blockers from earlier validation failures (syntax_error flags reported in several generated modules) by selecting one blessed pipeline implementation, fixing syntax errors in that chosen path, and deleting/ignoring duplicate broken variants; then rerun tests and store ./outputs/test_run.log.
missionSuccessCriteria: Complete strategic task identified by Meta-Coordinator or escalated by Strategic Tracker

Agent findings included multiple 'File validation complete ... failures: (syntax_error)' events, indicating broken variants exist. Consolidation + repair is needed to make the pipeline reliably runnable and prevent ongoing duplication.
